name.japanese: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

keyMoments.title: Marshall D. Teach Recommended as Warlord
keyMoments.description: Laffitte recommends Marshall D. Teach to Sengoku as a replacement for Crocodile among the Seven Warlords.
keyMoments.significance: First mention of Blackbeard's real name and his strategic plan to become a Warlord.

keyMoments.title: Blackbeard's Physical Debut
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard appears in Mock Town examining Luffy's 100 million bounty poster with interest.
keyMoments.significance: First physical appearance of one of the series' most important antagonists.
keyMoments.quote: One hundred million, eh? That's quite impressive.

keyMoments.title: Blackbeard's True Target Hinted
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard reveals he's hunting someone worth 100 million, implying it's not Luffy but someone else.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows his plan to capture Ace.
keyMoments.quote: I'm not interested in capturing weaklings. I'm after one man... one worth 100 million.

reveals.information: Real name is Marshall D. Teach, goes by Blackbeard
Seeking to become a Warlord of the Sea
Targeting someone worth 100 million berries to make his name known

name.japanese: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

keyMoments.title: Doflamingo's Cruel Debut
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo arrives at Mary Geoise and immediately uses his Devil Fruit powers to make Marines fight each other for entertainment.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Doflamingo as a cruel and powerful antagonist who disregards authority.
keyMoments.quote: Fuffuffuffu! This is boring. Let's liven things up a bit.

keyMoments.title: Attends Warlord Meeting
keyMoments.description: One of only three Warlords to attend Sengoku's emergency meeting.
keyMoments.significance: Shows his relative compliance compared to other Warlords, while still demonstrating his chaotic nature.

abilities.description: Doflamingo can control people like puppets using invisible strings from his Ito Ito no Mi.

reveals.information: Member of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
Possesses the Ito Ito no Mi (String-String Fruit)
Cruel and sadistic, enjoys tormenting others

name.japanese: バーソロミュー・くま

keyMoments.title: Kuma's Silent Entrance
keyMoments.description: Bartholomew Kuma arrives at Mary Geoise carrying his signature Bible, appearing calm and mysterious.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the most enigmatic Warlords who will play a crucial role in future arcs.

keyMoments.title: Attends Warlord Meeting
keyMoments.description: One of only three Warlords to attend Sengoku's emergency meeting.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his compliance with World Government orders.

reveals.information: Member of the Seven Warlords of the Sea

keyMoments.title: Laffitte Infiltrates Mary Geoise
keyMoments.description: Laffitte mysteriously infiltrates the highly secure Warlord meeting undetected, demonstrating incredible stealth abilities.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Laffitte's dangerous capabilities and the threat level of the Blackbeard Pirates.
keyMoments.quote: I'm here to recommend my captain for the now-vacant position of Warlord.

keyMoments.title: Recommends Blackbeard as Warlord
keyMoments.description: Laffitte formally recommends Marshall D. Teach to replace Crocodile.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Blackbeard Pirates' strategic planning and ambition.
keyMoments.quote: My captain and crew are currently hatching a plan to make our names known throughout the world.

reveals.information: Former West Blue police officer exiled for excessive violence
Can infiltrate highly secure locations undetected, possibly has wings

keyMoments.title: Spring Hopper Barrage
keyMoments.description: Bellamy uses his Devil Fruit powers to launch a devastating aerial attack on Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the full extent of Bellamy's Spring Spring Fruit abilities.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Luffy's Single Punch
keyMoments.description: Luffy defeats Bellamy with one devastating punch, leaving an imprint of his fist on Bellamy's face.
keyMoments.significance: Proves the vast gap in power between them and validates the importance of dreams.

abilities.description: Bellamy uses his spring legs to bounce off surfaces at high speed, creating a barrage of attacks.

reveals.information: Far weaker than Luffy despite similar bounty

keyMoments.title: Confronts Bellamy
keyMoments.description: Luffy calmly confronts Bellamy and demands the return of Cricket's stolen gold.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's maturity and focus compared to their previous encounter.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Bellamy with One Punch
keyMoments.description: Luffy defeats Bellamy with a single powerful downward punch.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's massive power increase since Alabasta and proves dreams are worth fighting for.

keyMoments.title: Points to the Sky
keyMoments.description: After victory, Luffy points dramatically to the sky, affirming his belief in dreams without words.
keyMoments.significance: Iconic moment proving that dreams and conviction matter more than cynicism.

bounties.reason: Defeating Crocodile and causing chaos in Alabasta

reveals.information: Strong enough to defeat Bellamy with a single punch

keyMoments.title: Five Elders Debut
keyMoments.description: The Five Elders appear for the first time at Mary Geoise, discussing world-threatening events.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the ultimate authority in the World Government and hints at the true scope of world politics.
keyMoments.quote: If those two were to meet, it would be too dangerous.

keyMoments.title: Discuss Shanks and Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: The Five Elders express concern about Shanks attempting to contact Whitebeard.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the World Government's fear of the Yonko cooperating.

reveals.information: Highest authority in the World Government
Aware of movements of the Yonko and major world events

voiceActors.japanese: Masato Hirano, Yasunori Masutani, Keiichi Noda, Kenichi Ogata, Keiichi Sonobe

keyMoments.title: Brief Appearance with Blackbeard
keyMoments.description: Doc Q appears with Blackbeard's crew in Mock Town, the sickly doctor on horseback.

name.japanese: ジーザス・バージェス

keyMoments.title: Brief Appearance with Blackbeard
keyMoments.description: Jesus Burgess appears with Blackbeard's crew in Mock Town.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of Blackbeard's helmsman and wrestler.

keyMoments.title: Brief Appearance with Blackbeard
keyMoments.description: Van Augur appears with Blackbeard's crew, discussing fate and destiny.

reveals.information: Believes everything is decided by fate
